title: AI-generated song banned from Swedish charts: ‘It’s deceiving’
description: A musician has reacted to a song streamed millions of times that has been banned from Sweden’s music charts for being created by Artificial Intelligence. The song, ‘Jag vet, du är inte min’ has been streamed more than five million times and is currently top of the Spotify playlist of Sweden's most popular songs. “The song is great, but unfortunately, it’s missing one of the most important ingredients, which is emotion,” guitarist Joe Matera told ABC News Australia on Friday (16 January). Matera, who is also a well-known rock journalist, said while the song is “very good,” it is also “deceiving.” “If it's using AI, let people know this was produced with AI,” he added. It comes after an Ipsos survey last November found 97 per cent of people failed to distinguish AI-generated tracks.
content:
A musician has reacted to a song streamed millions of times that has been banned from Sweden’s music charts for being created by Artificial Intelligence.

title: Melania left on mute: First Lady's tech speech plagued by 32 seconds of silence
description: First Lady Melania Trump was accidentally left on mute Friday when she appeared at a summit sponsored by Zoom to help children learn about artificial intelligence.

title: AI outpacing laws; govts need adaptive rules: WEF's Cathy Li
description: A recent study by the World Economic Forum (WEF) indicates that only about 1% of organizations have fully implemented responsible artificial intelligence (AI) practices. In an email exchange with ET, Cathy Li, head, Centre for AI Excellence and member of the executive committee, World Economic Forum stated that governments should focus on creating regulations that can adapt as AI technology develops, rather than attempting to keep pace with static rules.
content:
